flawed_nl_solution:
In the second month he can run 6 miles because 3 x 2 = <<3*2=6>>6
In the third month he can run 21 miles because 6 x 2 = <<6*2=21>>21
In fourth month he can run 42 miles because 21 x 2 = <<21*2=42>>42
In fifth month he can run 84 miles because 42 x 2 = <<42*2=84>>84
He needs to start training 5 months ahead of time because 42 < 26.3 and 84>26.3.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 12, not 21. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
